description: The specific diagnostic investigations that are requested as part of this request. Sometimes, there can only be one item per request, but in most contexts, more than one investigation can be requested.

element.definition: The specific diagnostic investigations that are requested as part of this request. Sometimes, there can only be one item per request, but in most contexts, more than one investigation can be requested.
Code to indicate the item (test, panel or sequence variant) being ordered.
element.short: Code to indicate the item (test, panel or sequence variant) being ordered

element.definition: Indicate the genetic variant ordered to be tested.
element.short: Indicate the genetic variant ordered to be tested

element.definition: If the item is related to a specific specimen.
element.short: If this item relates to specific specimens

element.definition: The status of this individual item within the order.
element.short: proposed | draft | planned | requested | received | accepted | in-progress | review | completed | cancelled | suspended | rejected | failed

name: Item

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
